intro: Tithymalus crispus, commonly known as the curled tithymalus, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in umbels. Native to Europe and parts of Asia, this plant thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its aromatic foliage and delicate blooms make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The plant's structure and growth habits reflect its adaptation to temperate climates and its role in supporting local pollinators.
